# ADR-021: Natural Language Input Normalization Architecture

The MCP-ocs system successfully implements deterministic template execution via ADR-014 (Deterministic Template Engine), but has an architectural gap in the input processing layer. Currently, natural language queries like "OpenShift ingress is acting up" are processed directly by the template selection engine without systematic normalization, leading to inconsistent template routing and suboptimal diagnostic workflows.
Natural Language Input ‚Üí ??? ‚Üí Template Selection (ADR-014) ‚Üí Tool Execution

# ADR-022: Normalized Fact Model (NFM) Type System Architecture

ADR-021 (Natural Language Input Normalization Architecture) successfully addresses phrase normalization and dictionary-based input processing. However, for domains requiring higher semantic precision and type safety (medical, financial, complex operational scenarios), simple phrase-to-canonical mapping is insufficient.
2. **Separate from Dictionary System** - ADR-021 works independently, NFM enhances when needed
- **ADR-021:** Solves phrase normalization and template routing (universally needed)
- **ADR-022:** Solves semantic type safety and constraint validation (domain-specific need)
- OpenShift operations work fine with ADR-021 dictionary normalization
- Dictionary system (ADR-021) has broad applicability across domains
- Can implement ADR-021 first, add NFM later when needed
- Can be implemented gradually after ADR-021 proves successful
- **ADR-021: Natural Language Input Normalization Architecture** - NFM extends dictionary normalization with semantic type safety
- **ADR-014: Deterministic Template Engine** - NFM-compatible templates integrate with existing engine
- **ADR-003: Memory Storage and Retrieval Patterns** - NFM constraint results can be cached in memory system

The Normalized Fact Model (NFM) Type System Architecture provides an optional semantic enhancement layer that can be selectively applied to domains requiring formal type safety and constraint validation. By maintaining clean separation from the dictionary normalization system (ADR-021), teams can adopt appropriate levels of semantic precision for their specific domain requirements.

Help run a problem‚Äëresolution sprint today.\n+\n+Working branch: release/v0.9.0-beta\n+Repository root: /Users/kevinbrown/MCP-ocs\n+\n+Read these for process context:\n+- sprint-management/TEMPLATE-USAGE-GUIDE-PROCESS-V3.3.2.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-developer.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-tester.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-reviewer.md\n+\n+Read current status sources and summarize plan of day:\n+- sprint-management/features/status.json\n+- sprint-management/features/planned-tools.json\n+\n+Constraints:\n+- Keep changes on release/v0.9.0-beta; docs go to main via my manual PR at EOD\n+- Use npm scripts for status/tools generation when proposing EOD actions\n+\n+Tasks now:\n+1) Propose today‚Äôs sprint focus from status.json\n+2) List the 2‚Äì3 highest‚Äëvalue tools/workflows to exercise\n+3) Confirm the minimal artifacts we‚Äôll produce today toward 20‚Äëartifact closure\n+```\n+\n+‚Äî\n+\n*** End Patch\nPATCH (Update)

# ADR-021: Natural Language Input Normalization Architecture

The MCP-ocs system successfully implements deterministic template execution via ADR-014 (Deterministic Template Engine), but has an architectural gap in the input processing layer. Currently, natural language queries like "OpenShift ingress is acting up" are processed directly by the template selection engine without systematic normalization, leading to inconsistent template routing and suboptimal diagnostic workflows.
Natural Language Input ‚Üí ??? ‚Üí Template Selection (ADR-014) ‚Üí Tool Execution

- **ADR-007: Automatic Tool Memory Integration** - Dictionary normalization automatically captured
The production operator deployment (ADR-008) requires enhanced GitOps integration across multiple pods:
### Integration Points with ADR-008 and ADR-009
**ADR-002 (GitOps Strategy):** Tool namespace management ensures proper tool selection for GitOps operations vs emergency procedures.
**ADR-003 (Memory Patterns):** Memory tools properly namespaced and context-aware to prevent conflicts with other domains.
**ADR-005 (Workflow State Machine):** State machine controls which tool namespaces are available during different workflow phases.
# ADR-022: Normalized Fact Model (NFM) Type System Architecture

ADR-021 (Natural Language Input Normalization Architecture) successfully addresses phrase normalization and dictionary-based input processing. However, for domains requiring higher semantic precision and type safety (medical, financial, complex operational scenarios), simple phrase-to-canonical mapping is insufficient.
2. **Separate from Dictionary System** - ADR-021 works independently, NFM enhances when needed
- **ADR-021:** Solves phrase normalization and template routing (universally needed)

- Can implement ADR-021 first, add NFM later when needed
- Can be implemented gradually after ADR-021 proves successful
- **ADR-021: Natural Language Input Normalization Architecture** - NFM extends dictionary normalization with semantic type safety
- **ADR-014: Deterministic Template Engine** - NFM-compatible templates integrate with existing engine
- **ADR-003: Memory Storage and Retrieval Patterns** - NFM constraint results can be cached in memory system

The Normalized Fact Model (NFM) Type System Architecture provides an optional semantic enhancement layer that can be selectively applied to domains requiring formal type safety and constraint validation. By maintaining clean separation from the dictionary normalization system (ADR-021), teams can adopt appropriate levels of semantic precision for their specific domain requirements.

- sprint-management/README.md\n@@\n-# Sprint Management Framework - Usage Guide\n+# Sprint Management Framework - Usage Guide\n+\n+## Operator One‚ÄëPager (Process 3.3.x)\n+\n+Use this as a daily memory refresh to run the sprint with minimal friction.\n+\n+1) Working Truth vs Archives\n+- Work on: `release/v0.9.0-beta`\n+- Docs/archives: `main` (receive docs from beta at EOD)\n+\n+2) Daily Flow (beta)\n+- Update status/tools if scope changed:\n+  - Edit: `sprint-management/features/status.json`, `sprint-management/features/planned-tools.json`\n+  - Generate tables: `npm run sprint:status` and `npm run sprint:tools`\n+- EOD export (one shot): `npm run process:sync-docs`\n+- Push beta: `git push origin release/v0.9.0-beta`\n+- Manually update main: open a docs‚Äëonly PR from beta ‚Üí main (your call)\n+\n+3) Sprint Close (3.3.2 standard = 20 artifacts)\n+- Prepare archive dir under features/archives or maintenance/archives\n+- Validate presence: `npm run sprint:validate-closure -- <archive-dir>`\n+- Open PR to main: title suggestion `docs(archives): <sprint-id> closure + daily sync`\n+\n+4) Quick Commands\n+- Status tables ‚Üí `npm run sprint:status`\n+- Tool inventory ‚Üí `npm run sprint:tools`\n+- Indices/registry ‚Üí `npm run archives:index`\n+- All EOD docs ‚Üí `npm run process:sync-docs`\n+- Closure gate ‚Üí `npm run sprint:validate-closure -- <archive-dir>`\n+\n+5) Version Standards (clarity)\n+- v3.3.2: 20‚Äëartifact closure is current (preferred)\n+- v3.3.1: 11‚Äëartifact minimum is legacy; upgrade when possible\n+- See: `sprint-management/docs/VERSION-STANDARDS.md`\n+\n+6) Kick off Claude (AI Scrum Master)\n+- Goal: start standup/kickoff with current context and files\n+- Copy/paste this into Claude (adjust sprint id as needed):\n+\n+```\n+You are the AI Scrum Master for Process v3.3.2. Help run a problem‚Äëresolution sprint today.\n+\n+Working branch: release/v0.9.0-beta\n+Repository root: /Users/kevinbrown/MCP-ocs\n+\n+Read these for process context:\n+- sprint-management/TEMPLATE-USAGE-GUIDE-PROCESS-V3.3.2.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-developer.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-tester.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-reviewer.md\n+\n+Read current status sources and summarize plan of day:\n+- sprint-management/features/status.json\n+- sprint-management/features/planned-tools.json\n+\n+Constraints:\n+- Keep changes on release/v0.9.0-beta; docs go to main via my manual PR at EOD\n+- Use npm scripts for status/tools generation when proposing EOD actions\n+\n+Tasks now:\n+1) Propose today‚Äôs sprint focus from status.json\n+2) List the 2‚Äì3 highest‚Äëvalue tools/workflows to exercise\n+3) Confirm the minimal artifacts we‚Äôll produce today toward 20‚Äëartifact closure\n+```\n+\n+‚Äî\n+\n*** End Patch\nPATCH (Update)

Help run a problem‚Äëresolution sprint today.\n+\n+Working branch: release/v0.9.0-beta\n+Repository root: /Users/kevinbrown/MCP-ocs\n+\n+Read these for process context:\n+- sprint-management/TEMPLATE-USAGE-GUIDE-PROCESS-V3.3.2.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-developer.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-tester.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-reviewer.md\n+\n+Read current status sources and summarize plan of day:\n+- sprint-management/features/status.json\n+- sprint-management/features/planned-tools.json\n+\n+Constraints:\n+- Keep changes on release/v0.9.0-beta; docs go to main via my manual PR at EOD\n+- Use npm scripts for status/tools generation when proposing EOD actions\n+\n+Tasks now:\n+1) Propose today‚Äôs sprint focus from status.json\n+2) List the 2‚Äì3 highest‚Äëvalue tools/workflows to exercise\n+3) Confirm the minimal artifacts we‚Äôll produce today toward 20‚Äëartifact closure\n+```\n+\n+‚Äî\n+\n*** End Patch\nPATCH (Update)

- sprint-management/README.md\n@@\n-# Sprint Management Framework - Usage Guide\n+# Sprint Management Framework - Usage Guide\n+\n+## Operator One‚ÄëPager (Process 3.3.x)\n+\n+Use this as a daily memory refresh to run the sprint with minimal friction.\n+\n+1) Working Truth vs Archives\n+- Work on: `release/v0.9.0-beta`\n+- Docs/archives: `main` (receive docs from beta at EOD)\n+\n+2) Daily Flow (beta)\n+- Update status/tools if scope changed:\n+  - Edit: `sprint-management/features/status.json`, `sprint-management/features/planned-tools.json`\n+  - Generate tables: `npm run sprint:status` and `npm run sprint:tools`\n+- EOD export (one shot): `npm run process:sync-docs`\n+- Push beta: `git push origin release/v0.9.0-beta`\n+- Manually update main: open a docs‚Äëonly PR from beta ‚Üí main (your call)\n+\n+3) Sprint Close (3.3.2 standard = 20 artifacts)\n+- Prepare archive dir under features/archives or maintenance/archives\n+- Validate presence: `npm run sprint:validate-closure -- <archive-dir>`\n+- Open PR to main: title suggestion `docs(archives): <sprint-id> closure + daily sync`\n+\n+4) Quick Commands\n+- Status tables ‚Üí `npm run sprint:status`\n+- Tool inventory ‚Üí `npm run sprint:tools`\n+- Indices/registry ‚Üí `npm run archives:index`\n+- All EOD docs ‚Üí `npm run process:sync-docs`\n+- Closure gate ‚Üí `npm run sprint:validate-closure -- <archive-dir>`\n+\n+5) Version Standards (clarity)\n+- v3.3.2: 20‚Äëartifact closure is current (preferred)\n+- v3.3.1: 11‚Äëartifact minimum is legacy; upgrade when possible\n+- See: `sprint-management/docs/VERSION-STANDARDS.md`\n+\n+6) Kick off Claude (AI Scrum Master)\n+- Goal: start standup/kickoff with current context and files\n+- Copy/paste this into Claude (adjust sprint id as needed):\n+\n+```\n+You are the AI Scrum Master for Process v3.3.2. Help run a problem‚Äëresolution sprint today.\n+\n+Working branch: release/v0.9.0-beta\n+Repository root: /Users/kevinbrown/MCP-ocs\n+\n+Read these for process context:\n+- sprint-management/TEMPLATE-USAGE-GUIDE-PROCESS-V3.3.2.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-developer.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-tester.md\n+- sprint-management/templates/current/role-context-reviewer.md\n+\n+Read current status sources and summarize plan of day:\n+- sprint-management/features/status.json\n+- sprint-management/features/planned-tools.json\n+\n+Constraints:\n+- Keep changes on release/v0.9.0-beta; docs go to main via my manual PR at EOD\n+- Use npm scripts for status/tools generation when proposing EOD actions\n+\n+Tasks now:\n+1) Propose today‚Äôs sprint focus from status.json\n+2) List the 2‚Äì3 highest‚Äëvalue tools/workflows to exercise\n+3) Confirm the minimal artifacts we‚Äôll produce today toward 20‚Äëartifact closure\n+```\n+\n+‚Äî\n+\n*** End Patch\nPATCH (Update)
